result.execSummary:
The defendant Genevieve E. Hirsch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resist/Obstruct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders fine for $295.00.  Court grants sentence credit for 2 days jail for $200.00 of the $295.00.  Defendant to pay the remaining $95.00 within 90 days.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Genevieve E. Hirsch

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Genevieve E. Hirsch in court with attorney Kathryn Graber.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to amend count #1 to a county ordinance.  Defendant pleads no contest to the amended count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  Counts 2 and 3 are dismissed and read in.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Graber makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.
Court orders the following:  FORFEITURE:  $295.00 Court gives the defendant credit for 2 days jail, Defendant gets credit for $200.00 of the $295.00.  Defendant to pay the remaining $95.00 within 90 days.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Defendant Genevieve E. Hirsch in court with attorney Joseph Smith.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is in treatment.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Genevieve E. Hirsch in court with attorney Joseph Smith.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is looking to enter the 180 progam if she can afford it.  Hearing scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victim/witness listed in the criminal complaint.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.   Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Genevieve E. Hirsch in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.    NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.
